700683f-a.title: Bronx: Bryant Avenue - 174th Street (East)
700683f-a.text:
Bryant Ave., west sfde, south from East 174th to East 173rd Street,
showing the undeveloped area extending west to Southern Boulevard (where
elevated structure of the I.R.T. Bronx Park subway line appears). The
buildings shown on the left face on the south side of East 173rd Street.
1917.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
W:



251

700682f-a.title: Bronx: Bryant Avenue - 174th Street
700682f-a.text:
1687-1711 Bryant Ave., adjoining the S.W. corner of East 174th Street,
showing the Denike Mansion,on the former estate of Colonel Abraham
(or Abram) Denike. The G.W. Bromley map of 1924 as revised to September
1932 shows the area to be a clearance,with the property immediately
surrounding it occupied by 6-story apartment buildings. The mansion was
demolished between 1913 and 1924 (see same maps).
1911.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
